abstract: To cope with the stress of conflict photography, Guillermo Cervera dives into the surf to photograph the perfect wave. How an old hand at the sea says a farewell to arms every now and then.
snippet: To cope with the stress of conflict photography, Guillermo Cervera dives into the surf to photograph the perfect wave. How an old hand at the sea says a farewell to arms every now and then.
lead_paragraph: Guillermo Cervera knows there is a certain risk lurking behind each assignment. In Libya, it came from the attack that claimed the lives of Tim Hetherington and Chris Hondros, who were by his side when they were felled in Misurata. In Chad, it was from a brief - though harrowing - detention, where he was threatened with torture.
